p.s: Every successful business has a risk-management plan .
Here is how to manage risk when trading stocks .

item.s: Cover your expenses every month .
Then concentrate on achieving a steady growth in earnings .

figure.rend: Find Tax Exemptions for Your Small Business Step 8.jpg

item.s: Rather than striving for the big hit , protect your capital first and work for consistent returns .
You can take more aggressive risk with a portion of profits .
The big hits and " home runs " will still come along , but let them arrive without taking excessive risk .
Base your stock-trading business philosophy on three principles ( in order of importance ) :
Preservation of capital
Consistent profitability
Pursuit of superior returns
Preserve capital in the interests of money management .
This is the cornerstone of stock trading .
Risk is the prime concern .

figure.rend: Follow the Mortgage Accelerator Plus Program Step 2.jpg

item.s: Before asking , " what kind of profit can I make ?
" , ask first , " what potential loss can I suffer ?
" This is astute stock-trading risk management .
A storekeeper takes a risk every time s/he stocks new merchandise .
If it does not sell , s/he will lose money .
A smart businessperson takes only risks that will not put him/her out of business , even if s/he makes several mistakes in a row .
Define your risk .
As a stock trader , you are in the business of trading .
You need to define your business risk , the most money you are willing to risk ( or lose ) on any single trade .
Here are some basic risk-management principles :

figure.rend: Manage Risk when Trading Stocks Step 4.jpg

item.s: There is no standard amount of money to risk , just like there is no standard business .
Your acceptable risk level depends on the size of your trading account , your trading method and your tolerance for " pain .
Beware of emotional trading .
Trading can be so exciting that it leads to emotional highs and lows in rapid succession .
It rarely happens that a trader will make serious money while riding an emotional roller coaster .
Emotional trading is the enemy of success .
Fear and greed can undo a stock trader .
A real professional does not get too ecstatic or too depressed about specific wins or losses .
This is a good mental state for stock trading and for life in general .
If you 're thinking about a past opportunity , you 'll miss the next one to come your way .

figure.rend: Get Coupons and Free Samples from Most Companies Step 8.jpg

item.s: Focus on being the best .
The goal of a successful professional in any field is to reach his/her personal best .
You need to concentrate on trading right .
Each trade has to be handled like a surgical procedure : seriously , soberly , without sloppiness or shortcuts .
This is a stock-trading risk-management plan .
A loser cannot cut his losses quickly .
When a trade starts going sour , the loser may hope and hang on while the losses pile up ; or he may sell his position just before the market comes roaring back .
Trends emerge because most losers are alike .
They act on their gut feelings instead of using their heads .
Personal emotions do n't follow cultural backgrounds or educational levels .
Emotional traders go into risky gambles to avoid taking certain losses .
It is human nature to take profits quickly and postpone taking losses .
Emotional trading destroys otherwise intelligent traders .
Good money management and timing techniques will keep them out of the hole .
Losing traders look for a " sure thing " , hang on out of hope , and irrationally refuse to accept small losses .
